events.title: Orientation Day
events.description: Welcome and orientation program for new students joining grades 1-11.
events.details: The Orientation Day provides an overview of school policies, curriculum, extracurricular activities, and facilities to new students and their parents. Students will also get to meet their teachers and classmates.

events.title: Bakrid
events.description: School holiday in observance of Bakrid festival.
events.details: Bakrid, also known as Eid al-Adha, is an important Islamic festival observed as a school holiday. The school remains closed on this day to respect the religious observance.

events.title: School Re-opening
events.description: First day of the new academic year for grades 1-12.
events.details: The school reopens for the academic year 2025-2026 for students in grades 1-12. Students will receive their new timetables, books, and other academic materials on this day.

events.title: Inauguration Day
events.description: Special inaugural ceremony for LKG and UKG students.
events.details: A special ceremony to welcome the youngest members of our school community. LKG and UKG students will participate in fun activities designed to make their first day memorable and exciting.

events.title: School Re-opening
events.description: First day of the new academic year for Kindergarten students.
events.details: The school reopens for Kindergarten students for the academic year 2025-2026. This day focuses on helping young students adjust to the school environment through engaging activities.

events.title: Centum Result Holiday
events.description: School holiday to celebrate outstanding academic achievements.
events.details: A special holiday granted to celebrate and recognize the exceptional academic performance of students who achieved centum (100%) results in their examinations.

events.title: Debate & Elocution
events.description: Debate and elocution competition for students of grades 5-6.
events.details: This event provides a platform for students to enhance their public speaking skills and critical thinking abilities through structured debates and eloquent speeches on contemporary topics.

events.title: Investiture Voting Ceremony
events.description: Election process for student leadership positions for grades 6-11.
events.details: The Investiture Voting Ceremony is an important democratic process where students from grades 6-11 elect their student leaders for the academic year. This fosters leadership skills and democratic values.

events.title: Investiture Ceremony
events.description: Formal ceremony to invest powers in elected student leaders from grades 9 & 11.
events.details: The Investiture Ceremony is a prestigious event where elected student council members from grades 9 & 11 are officially appointed to their leadership positions and take an oath to serve the school community responsibly.

events.title: Colors Day
events.description: A vibrant celebration of colors for Kindergarten and grades 1 & 2 students.
events.details: Colors Day is an exciting event for younger students to learn about colors through various fun activities. Students participate in color-themed games, crafts, and learning experiences.

events.title: Science and Math Quiz Competition
events.description: Interactive quiz competition focusing on science and mathematics for grades 3 & 4.
events.details: This competition aims to foster interest in science and mathematics through engaging quiz rounds that challenge students' knowledge and problem-solving abilities in a fun environment.

events.title: Second Saturday
events.description: School holiday on second Saturday of the month.
events.details: As per the school calendar, the second Saturday of every month is observed as a holiday for all students and staff members.

events.title: Education Development Day
events.description: Day dedicated to educational development activities and workshops.
events.details: Education Development Day is observed to emphasize the importance of continuous learning and educational innovation. Various activities are organized to enhance students' learning experiences.

events.title: Debate and Elocution Competition
events.description: Competitive event showcasing oratory skills for grades 5 & 6.
events.details: This competition encourages students to develop their public speaking abilities, critical thinking, and confidence through prepared speeches and impromptu debates on diverse topics.
activities: Awards for best speakers and debaters

events.title: Ist Mid Term Test
events.description: First mid-term assessment for students from UKG to Grade 9.
events.details: The first mid-term assessment of the academic year evaluates students' understanding of concepts covered thus far. This helps in identifying learning gaps and providing necessary support.

events.title: Science and Math Quiz Competition
events.description: Interactive quiz competition on science and mathematics for grades 5 & 6.
events.details: This quiz competition challenges students' knowledge in science and mathematics through various engaging rounds that promote analytical thinking and subject mastery.

events.title: Debate and Elocution Competition
events.description: Competition to showcase public speaking skills for grades 7 & 8.
events.details: This competition provides a platform for middle school students to demonstrate their oratory skills, critical thinking, and persuasive abilities through structured debates and eloquent speeches.

events.title: Mid Term Exam Ends
events.description: Conclusion of mid-term examinations for grades 7 & 8.
events.details: The last day of mid-term examinations for grades 7 & 8. Students will receive their answer sheets and discuss their performance with subject teachers after the exams.

events.title: First-aid, Fire and Safety Workshop
events.description: Educational workshop on safety protocols for grades 9-12.
events.details: This essential workshop trains older students in basic first-aid techniques, fire safety measures, and emergency protocols to foster a safety-conscious environment within the school community.

events.title: Grandparents Day
events.description: Special celebration honoring the grandparents of Kindergarten students.
events.details: Grandparents Day is a heartwarming event that celebrates the special bond between grandparents and their grandchildren. Kindergarten students perform for their grandparents and engage in activities together.
activities: Interactive games for grandparents and children

events.title: Spell Bee
events.description: Spelling competition for students in grades 1-2.
events.details: The Spell Bee competition helps young students improve their vocabulary, spelling skills, and confidence in using the English language through a series of engaging spelling challenges.

events.title: Debate Elocution
events.description: Public speaking event for students in grades 7-8.
events.details: This event showcases the oratory and persuasive skills of middle school students through prepared speeches, impromptu talks, and structured debates on contemporary topics.

events.title: Van Mahotsav Day
events.description: Environmental awareness and tree planting event for grades 1-12.
events.details: Van Mahotsav Day promotes environmental consciousness through tree planting activities and educational sessions about the importance of forests and conservation efforts.

events.title: Science & Maths Quiz
events.description: Knowledge-testing quiz competition for grades 5-6.
events.details: This interactive quiz challenges students' understanding of scientific principles and mathematical concepts through various rounds designed to promote critical thinking and subject mastery.

events.title: Dheerachinnamalai
events.description: Commemorative event honoring Dheeran Chinnamalai.
events.details: This event commemorates the legacy of Dheeran Chinnamalai, a Tamil freedom fighter. Though not specifically for students (marked as NA), the school acknowledges this important historical figure.

events.title: Spell Bee Competition
events.description: Spelling competition for students in grades 1 & 2.
events.details: This spelling competition aims to enhance students' vocabulary, spelling accuracy, and confidence in English language usage through progressively challenging spelling rounds.

events.title: Raksha Bandhan Celebration
events.description: Cultural celebration of the Raksha Bandhan festival for grades 5-8.
events.details: This celebration honors the bond between brothers and sisters through the traditional Raksha Bandhan festival. Students participate in cultural activities that highlight the significance of this relationship.

events.title: Second Saturday
events.description: School holiday on second Saturday of the month.
events.details: As per the school calendar, the second Saturday of every month is observed as a holiday for all students and staff members.

events.title: Spell Bee Competition
events.description: Spelling competition for students in grades 3 & 4.
events.details: This spelling competition challenges students with age-appropriate vocabulary to improve their spelling skills, word recognition, and language confidence.

events.title: Sports Day
events.description: Day of athletic competitions and sports activities for all students.
events.details: Sports Day features various athletic competitions and team sports that showcase students' physical abilities, sportsmanship, and team spirit across different age groups.

events.title: Sports Day & Independence Day
events.description: Combined celebration of Sports Day finals and Independence Day.
events.details: A special event combining the finals of the Sports Day competitions with patriotic celebrations for India's Independence Day, featuring flag hoisting, march past, and cultural performances.
events.organizer: Physical Education Department and Cultural Committee

events.title: Krishna Jayanthi
events.description: School holiday for Krishna Jayanthi festival.
events.details: The school observes Krishna Jayanthi (Janmashtami) as a holiday to honor the birth of Lord Krishna, an important Hindu deity and figure in Indian culture.

events.title: Interschool Competition
events.description: Competitive events between schools for students in grades 1-4.
events.details: This interschool competition brings together students from various schools to compete in a range of academic, artistic, and performance-based activities, fostering healthy competition and exposure.

events.title: Vinayagar Chathurthi
events.description: School holiday for Vinayagar Chathurthi festival.
events.details: The school observes Vinayagar Chathurthi (Ganesh Chaturthi) as a holiday to celebrate Lord Ganesha, the remover of obstacles and patron of arts and sciences in Hindu tradition.

events.title: Art/Poster Making Competition
events.description: Creative art competition for all students.
events.details: This competition encourages students to express their creativity and artistic skills through poster making on various themes related to social awareness, environmental conservation, or cultural significance.

events.title: Fruits Day
events.description: Educational day focused on fruits for Kindergarten students.
events.details: Fruits Day is a fun and educational event where kindergarten students learn about different fruits, their nutritional benefits, and importance in a healthy diet through interactive activities.

events.title: Teacher's Day Celebration
events.description: Special event honoring teachers and their contributions.
events.details: Teacher's Day celebrates the invaluable contribution of educators to society. Students prepare special performances and tokens of appreciation to honor their teachers on this significant day.
activities: Fun activities organized by senior students

events.title: Milad - Un - Nabi
events.description: School holiday observing the birth of Prophet Muhammad.
events.details: The school observes Milad-un-Nabi as a holiday to respect the commemoration of the birth of Prophet Muhammad, an important observance in Islamic tradition.

events.title: Art/Poster Making
events.description: Creative art session for students in grades 1-12.
events.details: This art session provides students with an opportunity to express their creativity through poster making on various themes that promote awareness about social issues, environmental conservation, or cultural heritage.

events.title: Vegetables Day
events.description: Educational day focused on vegetables for Kindergarten students.
events.details: Vegetables Day is an interactive learning experience where kindergarten students discover various vegetables, their nutritional benefits, and importance in maintaining good health through fun activities.

events.title: Field Trip
events.description: Educational excursion for students in grades 3 & 4.
events.details: This field trip provides students with experiential learning opportunities outside the classroom, visiting educational sites that complement their curriculum and expand their understanding of real-world applications.

events.title: Field Trip
events.description: Educational excursion for students in grades 5 & 6.
events.details: This field trip offers middle school students hands-on learning experiences at carefully selected locations that enhance their understanding of concepts learned in the classroom and provide real-world context.

events.title: Milad-un Nabi Celebration
events.description: Cultural celebration of Prophet Muhammad's birthday.
events.details: This cultural event celebrates the birth of Prophet Muhammad through educational presentations, recitations, and activities that promote understanding of Islamic traditions and values of peace and compassion.

events.title: Quarterly Exam Begins
events.description: First quarter examinations begin for all students.
events.details: The quarterly examinations assess students' understanding and application of concepts covered during the first term. These exams play an important role in evaluating academic progress.

events.title: Quarterly Exam Ends
events.description: Conclusion of first quarter examinations for all students.
events.details: The final day of quarterly examinations marks the completion of the first formal assessment period of the academic year. Students will receive their results after evaluation is complete.

events.title: Field Trip & I Term Holiday Starts
events.description: Start of term break holidays following field trips.
events.details: This day marks the beginning of the first term holidays following the completion of quarterly examinations and field trips. Students will enjoy a well-deserved break before the next academic term begins.
activities: Term break begins for all students

events.title: School Re-opening
events.description: First day back after term break for all students.
events.details: The school reopens after the first term holidays. Students return to regular classes with quarterly examination results and feedback to guide their academic focus for the next term.

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Grade 10 students.
events.details: This Parent-Teacher Meeting provides an opportunity for parents of Grade 10 students to discuss their child's academic performance in the quarterly examinations and set goals for the crucial pre-board preparation year.

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Grade 12 students.
events.details: This critical Parent-Teacher Meeting focuses on Grade 12 students' performance in the quarterly examinations and provides guidance for board examination preparation and higher education planning.

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Kindergarten through Grade 9 students.
events.details: This Parent-Teacher Meeting allows parents of students from Kindergarten through Grade 9 to discuss their child's progress, review quarterly examination results, and collaborate with teachers on strategies for improvement.
activities: Review of academic and co-curricular performance

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Grade 11 students.
events.details: This Parent-Teacher Meeting focuses on Grade 11 students' adaptation to higher secondary curriculum, their performance in quarterly examinations, and guidance for future academic planning.

events.title: Abdul Kalam Birthday & Greeny Floral Day
events.description: Celebration of Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam's birthday combined with environmental awareness activities.
events.details: This special day honors the birth anniversary of Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam, former President of India and renowned scientist, while also promoting environmental consciousness through greening and floral activities.
activities: Special assembly on Dr. Kalam's contributions
Reading circles featuring Dr. Kalam's books

events.title: Food Day
events.description: Educational day about nutrition and food for Kindergarten students.
events.details: Food Day provides kindergarten students with a fun and interactive learning experience about different food groups, balanced diets, and healthy eating habits through age-appropriate activities.

events.title: Diwali Holiday
events.description: School holiday for Diwali festival.
events.details: The school begins its Diwali holiday period, allowing students and staff to celebrate the Festival of Lights with their families and communities.

events.title: Diwali Holiday
events.description: Continued school holiday for Diwali festival.
events.details: The school remains closed as part of the extended Diwali holiday period, allowing for the celebration of this important cultural festival.

events.title: Diwali Holiday
events.description: Final day of school holiday for Diwali festival.
events.details: The final day of the Diwali holiday period before school resumes normal operations. Students and staff conclude their festival celebrations and prepare to return to school.

events.title: School Re-opening
events.description: First day back after Diwali holidays for all students.
events.details: The school reopens after the Diwali holiday break. Students return to their regular academic schedule and resume learning activities across all grade levels.

events.title: Talent Hunt Show
events.description: Performance showcase for students in grades 1 & 2.
events.details: The Talent Hunt Show provides a platform for young students to showcase their diverse talents in performing arts, music, dance, and other creative expressions in a supportive environment.

events.title: Story Telling Competition
events.description: Narrative competition for students in grades 1 & 2.
events.details: This competition encourages young students to develop their narrative skills, imagination, and confidence through engaging storytelling presentations using various techniques and props.
activities: Use of props and visual aids

events.title: Mental Math
events.description: Mathematical skills competition for all students.
events.details: The Mental Math competition challenges students' mathematical thinking, calculation speed, and problem-solving abilities without the use of calculators or other aids, promoting mental agility.

events.title: Career Guidance Workshop
events.description: Educational and career planning workshop for grades 9 & 10.
events.details: This comprehensive workshop provides students with valuable insights into various career paths, educational requirements, and future planning strategies to help them make informed decisions about their academic journey.
activities: Presentations by professionals from various fields

events.title: Fancy Dress Competition
events.description: Creative costume contest for Kindergarten students.
events.details: The Fancy Dress Competition allows kindergarten students to showcase their creativity and imagination through costumes representing various characters, professions, or concepts in a fun and supportive environment.

events.title: Second Saturday
events.description: School holiday on second Saturday of the month.
events.details: As per the school calendar, the second Saturday of every month is observed as a holiday for all students and staff members.

events.title: Story Telling Competition
events.description: Narrative competition for students in grades 1 & 2.
events.details: This competition encourages young students to develop their storytelling abilities, language skills, and confidence through prepared narratives delivered with expression and creativity.

events.title: Children's Day Event
events.description: Special celebration organized by teachers for Children's Day.
events.details: On Children's Day, teachers organize special performances and activities to celebrate childhood and honor students. This reversal of roles creates a joyful atmosphere where teachers entertain the students.

events.title: Annual Day
events.description: Grand cultural showcase and prize distribution ceremony.
events.details: The Annual Day is the school's premier event showcasing students' talents through cultural performances and celebrating academic and co-curricular achievements with formal recognition and awards.

events.title: Second Saturday
events.description: School holiday on second Saturday of the month.
events.details: As per the school calendar, the second Saturday of every month is observed as a holiday for all students and staff members.

events.title: Science Expo
events.description: Exhibition of scientific projects and innovations.
events.details: The Science Expo showcases student projects demonstrating scientific principles, innovations, and research. It provides a platform for students to present their scientific understanding and creativity to peers, teachers, and parents.

events.title: Transport Day
events.description: Educational day about transportation for Kindergarten students.
events.details: Transport Day introduces young students to different modes of transportation, their functions, and basic road safety through age-appropriate activities and visual learning experiences.

events.title: JCI GK Competition Level 1
events.description: General knowledge competition for grades 1-9.
events.details: The first level of the JCI General Knowledge Competition tests students' awareness of current affairs, history, geography, science, and other general knowledge subjects through a structured competitive format.

events.title: Mental Math Challenge
events.description: Mathematical computation competition for grades 3-8.
events.details: This challenge tests students' ability to perform rapid mental calculations without calculators, enhancing numerical skills, arithmetic speed, and mathematical reasoning abilities.

events.title: Cyber Safety Workshop
events.description: Educational workshop on internet safety for grades 7-12.
events.details: This essential workshop educates students about online safety, digital citizenship, cyberbullying prevention, and responsible use of social media and internet resources in the modern digital world.

events.title: Half Yearly Exam Starts
events.description: Beginning of mid-year examinations for all students.
events.details: The Half Yearly Examinations assess students' understanding and retention of concepts covered during the first half of the academic year across all subjects in their curriculum.

events.title: Half Yearly Exam Ends
events.description: Conclusion of mid-year examinations for all students.
events.details: The final day of Half Yearly Examinations marks the completion of the mid-year assessment period. Students will receive their results after the winter break.

events.title: Holiday Starts
events.description: Beginning of winter break for all students.
events.details: The winter holidays begin following the completion of Half Yearly Examinations. Students will enjoy a well-deserved break during the festive season before returning for the new calendar year.

events.title: School Re-opening
events.description: First day back after winter break for all students.
events.details: The school reopens after the winter holidays. Students return to regular classes with Half Yearly Examination results that will guide their academic focus for the remainder of the school year.
activities: Distribution of half yearly examination results

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Grade 10 students.
events.details: This critical Parent-Teacher Meeting discusses Grade 10 students' performance in the Half Yearly Examinations and provides guidance for board examination preparation in the final months before pre-board examinations.
activities: Review of half yearly examination performance

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Grade 12 students.
events.details: This crucial Parent-Teacher Meeting addresses Grade 12 students' performance in the Half Yearly Examinations and provides targeted guidance for board examination and competitive examination preparation.

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Kindergarten through Grade 9 students.
events.details: This Parent-Teacher Meeting provides an opportunity for parents to discuss their child's performance in the Half Yearly Examinations and collaborate with teachers on strategies for improvement in the second half of the academic year.
activities: Discussion of half yearly examination results

events.title: PTM Meeting with Parents
events.description: Parent-Teacher Meeting for Grade 11 students.
events.details: This Parent-Teacher Meeting addresses Grade 11 students' performance in the Half Yearly Examinations and provides guidance for the challenging second half of the academic year, laying groundwork for Grade 12 preparation.

events.title: Pongal Celebration
events.description: Cultural celebration of Pongal harvest festival for Kindergarten students.
events.details: Kindergarten students participate in age-appropriate activities celebrating the traditional Tamil harvest festival of Pongal, learning about cultural traditions and agricultural practices.

events.title: Pongal Holidays
events.description: School holiday for Pongal festival celebrations.
events.details: The school observes holidays for the Pongal festival, allowing students and staff to participate in this important cultural harvest celebration with their families and communities.

events.title: School Re-opening
events.description: First day back after Pongal holidays for all students.
events.details: The school reopens after the Pongal festival holidays. Students resume their regular academic schedule with renewed focus on preparation for upcoming examinations and learning activities.

events.title: Coding & Robotics Workshop
events.description: Technical skills workshop for students in grades 7-8.
events.details: This hands-on workshop introduces middle school students to basic coding concepts and robotics applications, fostering computational thinking, problem-solving skills, and interest in STEM fields.

events.title: Kids Expo
events.description: Exhibition showcasing kindergarten students' work and activities.
events.details: Kids Expo is a delightful showcase of kindergarten students' artwork, craft projects, and learning outcomes, allowing parents to appreciate their children's progress and creative development.

events.title: Literacy Day
events.description: Day promoting reading and literacy for Kindergarten through Grade 12.
events.details: Literacy Day celebrates the importance of reading and writing skills through various age-appropriate activities that encourage students to develop a lifelong love for reading and literature.

events.title: Republic Day
events.description: Patriotic celebration of India's Republic Day.
events.details: The school celebrates Republic Day with a flag hoisting ceremony, patriotic performances, and activities that promote civic values and appreciation of India's constitutional democracy.

events.title: Mock Board Exams Starts
events.description: Practice board examinations for grades 9 & 10.
events.details: Mock Board Examinations provide students with a realistic experience of board examination conditions, helping them prepare for the actual board exams by identifying strengths and areas for improvement.

events.title: Pre Board Exams Starts
events.description: Final practice examinations for grades 11 & 12 before board exams.
events.details: Pre-Board Examinations provide a comprehensive assessment of students' preparation for board examinations, covering the complete syllabus under examination conditions identical to the actual board exams.

events.title: Pre Board Exams Ends
events.description: Conclusion of final practice examinations for grades 11 & 12.
events.details: The final day of Pre-Board Examinations for grades 11 & 12. Detailed performance analysis and guidance will be provided to help students prepare for their upcoming board examinations.

events.title: State Level GK Competition
events.description: High-level general knowledge competition for select students.
events.details: This prestigious state-level General Knowledge Competition brings together top-performing students (Excel 8) to compete against participants from other schools, showcasing their knowledge across various subjects.

events.title: Green Day (Sapling Trees)
events.description: Environmental awareness day for Kindergarten students.
events.details: Green Day introduces young students to environmental consciousness through tree planting and nature-based activities, fostering an early appreciation for environmental stewardship.

events.title: II Mid Term Exam Starts
events.description: Second mid-term assessment for UKG to Grade 9 students.
events.details: The second mid-term examinations assess students' understanding of concepts covered since the half-yearly examinations, providing important feedback before the final annual examinations.

events.title: Ramzan Fasting Starts
events.description: Recognition of the beginning of Ramzan fasting period.
events.details: The school acknowledges the beginning of the holy month of Ramzan (Ramadan), making appropriate accommodations for students who are fasting while maintaining regular academic schedules.

events.title: Farewell Day
events.description: Graduation ceremony for outgoing students of grades 11 & 12.
events.details: This emotional ceremony marks the end of the school journey for graduating students, celebrating their achievements and wishing them success as they move to higher education and future endeavors.

events.title: Graduation Day
events.description: Ceremony celebrating Kindergarten students completing their early education.
events.details: Graduation Day celebrates the milestone achievement of kindergarten students as they complete their early education and prepare to transition to primary school, marking their first academic graduation.

events.title: Second Saturday
events.description: School holiday on second Saturday of the month.
events.details: As per the school calendar, the second Saturday of every month is observed as a holiday for all students and staff members.

events.title: Annual Exam Begins
events.description: Final examinations for Grade 9 students.
events.details: The Annual Examinations for Grade 9 begin, assessing students' understanding and application of concepts covered throughout the academic year across all subjects in their curriculum.

events.title: Annual Exam Ends
events.description: Conclusion of final examinations for Grade 9 students.
events.details: The Annual Examinations for Grade 9 conclude. These comprehensive assessments determine students' final grades and readiness for promotion to the next academic level.

events.title: Half Working Day Lalatul-Qadr
events.description: Early dismissal in observance of Lailatul Qadr.
events.details: The school observes a half working day in respect for Lailatul Qadr (Night of Power), an important night during the holy month of Ramzan in Islamic tradition.

events.title: Holiday Starts
events.description: Beginning of pre-festival holidays.
events.details: The school begins a short holiday period leading up to several cultural and religious observances that occur in mid-March.

events.title: Holiday
events.description: Continued school holiday.
events.details: The school remains closed as part of the holiday period for cultural and religious observances.

events.title: Telugu New Year
events.description: School holiday for Telugu New Year celebration.
events.details: The school observes a holiday for Telugu New Year (Ugadi), an important cultural festival marking the beginning of a new year according to the Telugu lunar calendar.

events.title: Ramzan / Eid ul Fitr
events.description: School holiday for Eid ul Fitr celebration.
events.details: The school observes a holiday for Eid ul Fitr, marking the end of the holy month of Ramzan and celebrating the completion of the fasting period with prayers and festivities.

events.title: Holiday
events.description: Extended holiday after Eid ul Fitr.
events.details: The school remains closed, extending the holiday period following Eid ul Fitr celebrations.

events.title: Annual Exam Begins
events.description: Final examinations for Kindergarten to Grade 5 students.
events.details: The Annual Examinations begin for Kindergarten through Grade 5 students, assessing their learning outcomes and academic progress throughout the year in an age-appropriate manner.

events.title: Annual Exam Begins
events.description: Final examinations for Grade 6-8 students.
events.details: The Annual Examinations begin for students in Grades 6-8, comprehensively assessing their understanding and application of concepts covered throughout the academic year.

events.title: Annual Exam Ends
events.description: Conclusion of final examinations for Kindergarten to Grade 5.
events.details: The Annual Examinations conclude for Kindergarten through Grade 5 students. These assessments help determine their readiness for the next academic level.

events.title: Good Friday
events.description: School holiday for Good Friday observance.
events.details: The school observes Good Friday as a holiday, respecting the Christian commemoration of the crucifixion of Jesus Christ and his death at Calvary.

events.title: Annual Exam Ends
events.description: Conclusion of final examinations for Grade 6-8 students.
events.details: The Annual Examinations conclude for students in Grades 6-8. These comprehensive assessments determine students' final grades and readiness for promotion to the next academic level.

events.title: Summer Vacation Starts
events.description: Beginning of summer break for Grade 6-8 students.
events.details: The summer vacation begins for students in Grades 6-8 following the completion of their Annual Examinations. The school will reopen for the new academic year as per the next year's calendar.
